title: How to Do Tai Sabaki (martial Arts Body Shifting)

steps.title: From Migi Hanmi, slide your front foot diagonally (about 40 degrees to your right).
steps.content: From Migi Hanmi, slide your front foot diagonally (about 40 degrees to your right). Bring your back foot up to resume your stance. Your left foot will still be at the back of your right foot.

steps.title: From Migi Hanmi, step through with the back foot, diagonally off the line of attack.
steps.content: From Migi Hanmi, step through with the back foot, diagonally off the line of attack. Your back foot will now become your front foot. Bring the other foot in behind to resume your stance. When you have completed the movement, you should have changed your stance to Hidari Hanmi.

steps.title: From Migi Hanmi, pivot 180 degrees on the balls of your feet to end up facing the opposite direction.
steps.content: From Migi Hanmi, pivot 180 degrees on the balls of your feet to end up facing the opposite direction. If at the starting position, you face north in Migi Hanmi, when you have completed the movement, you will be facing south and be in Hidari Hanmi.

steps.title: From Migi Hanmi, step slightly forward and off the line of attack with the front foot.
steps.content: From Migi Hanmi, step slightly forward and off the line of attack with the front foot. Turn in the direction of your back 180 degrees by bringing the other foot around behind. You will now be facing south and still in Migi Hanmi stance.

steps.title: This movement is also commonly known as "kaiten."
steps.content: This movement is also commonly known as "kaiten." From Migi Hanmi, perform Issoku Irimi, that is, step through with the back foot. Then pivoting on the ball of the new front foot, turn 180 degrees in the direction of your back. You should now be facing in the opposite direction and in the opposite stance (Hidari Hanmi) to when you started.

steps.title: From Migi Hanmi, perform Issoku Irimi that is step through with the back foot.
steps.content: From Migi Hanmi, perform Issoku Irimi that is step through with the back foot. Pivot on the ball of your front foot (left foot), then turn as if performing a tenkan but only 90 degrees (to your right). Your back should be facing west and you should now be facing off to the side of your original direction (your front body will now be facing east)in Hidari Hanmi (that is the opposite stance to when you started).

steps.title: Practice Tai Sabaki often to make the movements second nature.
steps.content: Practice Tai Sabaki often to make the movements second nature.
